alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo; Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 5:50PM PST until January 10 at 12:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PST TONIGHT FOR CENTRAL SAN LUIS OBISPO AND SANTA BARBARA COUNTIES... At 550 PM PST, Radar and automated gauges have indicated heavy rain falling over the area with local law enforcement reporting widespread dangerous flash flooding over the warned area. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen, with up to a foot of rain in the higher terrain. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring with feet of water over many roads and freeways. This very dangerous flash-flooding situation will continue into the early overnight hours. This type of flooding at night has the potential to be deadly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Santa Maria, Santa Barbara, San Luis Obispo, Lompoc, Pismo Beach, Santa Ynez, Montecito, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Carpinteria, Solvang, Vandenberg Air Force Base, Los Alamos, Orcutt, Highway 101 through Gaviota State Park, and Refugio State Beach. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
